acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All integration-test helpers and raw commands set BD_DATA_DIR per runtime
- [ ] daemon_lifecycle and critical_path tests no longer fail due to store lock conflicts
- [ ] cargo test passes (or targeted suites) after the change
description: Integration tests that spawn `bd` set runtime/WAL dirs but not BD_DATA_DIR. The daemon then uses the default store path and can collide with a developer daemon or other test daemons, causing lock_held failures.
design: Derive a temp data dir from each test runtime dir (e.g., runtime_dir/data) and set BD_DATA_DIR on every integration-test `bd` command (helpers + direct invocations). Ensure the directory exists before spawning commands.
title: Integration tests isolate BD_DATA_DIR per runtime

acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] Existing serialized strings remain accepted and produced.

description:
**Problem**
- `core::ErrorCode` mixes realtime protocol codes with legacy CLI/IPC codes, obscuring stability boundaries.
- It is unclear which codes are normative vs compatibility only.

**Files:**
- src/core/error.rs
- REALTIME_ERRORS.md
- CLI_SPEC.md (if needed)
- src/daemon/ipc.rs (mapping)
design:
- Introduce `ProtocolErrorCode` (realtime/replication/IPC stable) and `LegacyErrorCode`.
- Wrap them in `ErrorCode` or introduce `ErrorCode::Protocol/Legacy`.
- Preserve current string values for compatibility; parsing should accept legacy names.
- Update docs to state which codes are protocol-stable vs legacy.
title: Separate protocol error codes from legacy CLI codes

description:
**Problem**
`DepKey` is stored both as the map key AND inside `DepEdge.key`:
```rust
deps: BTreeMap<DepKey, DepEdge>

pub struct DepEdge {
    pub key: DepKey,      // <-- duplicates the map key
    pub created: Stamp,
    pub life: Lww<DepLife>,
}
```

This duplication means:
1. Wasted memory
2. Possible key/value mismatch bugs (though unlikely)

**Design**
Remove `key` from `DepEdge`:
```rust
pub struct DepEdge {
    pub created: Stamp,
    pub life: Lww<DepLife>,
}
```

Callers that need the key get it from the map iteration:
```rust
for (key, edge) in &state.deps {
    // key is available here
}
```

**Design Notes**
- Wire format needs to handle this - on serialization, include key; on deserialization, reconstruct
- `DepEdge::new` and `DepEdge::join` signatures change (no longer take/return key)
- Check all usages of `edge.key` and ensure key is available from context

**Acceptance**
- [ ] `DepEdge` no longer contains `key` field
- [ ] Wire format correctly serializes/deserializes (key comes from map, not struct)
- [ ] All `edge.key` usages updated to use key from iteration context
- [ ] `DepEdge::new`/`join` updated
- [ ] Tests pass

**Files:** src/core/dep.rs, src/git/wire.rs, src/daemon/executor.rs
title: Remove duplicate key from DepEdge
